resources.string: Adaptive Cruise Go Notifier alerts you when Adaptive Cruise Control brings the vehicle to a complete stop behind another stopping vehicle and that vehicle begins moving again.
This setting specifies the amount of detail provided by the Voice Recognition system when giving you feedback. Select Auto to make the system adjust automatically to your speech habits.

This setting adjusts the formality of voice prompts. Select On to hear prompts with more personality. Select Off for shorter, more direct prompts. Select Auto to make the prompt style match your command style.
The Audio Cues are currently set to Off. Turn Audio Cues on to adjust the volume setting for these sounds.
Set Time allows you to manually set the time. Use the controls to adjust the time.
This setting specifies how often the Voice Recognition system confirms commands. Select Confirm More to make the system check with you frequently before acting on your commands.
Vehicle Locator Lights briefly turns on the exterior lights when you press the unlock button on the Remote Keyless Transmitter.
Set Audio Volume Limit specifies the maximum allowable audio volume for Teen Drivers.
Language indicates the language displayed in the instrument cluster and radio displays. %1$s
You are about to reset all vehicle settings for the current user.
The vehicle must be switched on to access this setting.
The selected language does not support Voice Recognition and Audio Feedback. Select a different language to enable Voice Recognition and Audio Feedback.
The selected language does not support Voice Recognition. Select a different language to enable Voice Recognition.
Your new calibration has been saved.
Your touchscreen calibration has not been saved. You must press the dot on the screen to complete touchscreen calibration.
Teen Driver Speed Warning warns you when a Teen Driver exceeds the specified maximum speed.\nSet the speed warning threshold under Set Teen Driver Speed Warning.
You are about to delete app data settings, user profiles and personal data from the vehicle, including Navigation and Phone data.
You are about to reset all your radio system and application preference settings for the current user.
The Automatic Time Zone feature is unavailable because your %1$s subscription has expired.
The lock codes that you entered do not match. Press retry and re-enter the lock code to set your system to Valet mode.
The lock code must be 4 digits long. Press Retry and enter the digits you set when setting the system to Valet mode.
Valet Mode – Enter Code to Unlock
The code you have entered is incorrect. Enter the digits you set when setting the system to Valet mode.
Teen Driver mode allows you to assign keys with customisable restrictions. Refer to your Owner\'s Manual for details.
The PIN must be 4 digits long.
The PIN that you entered does not match.
You may retry entering the PIN to set Teen Driver Mode.
You are about to remove the current Teen Driver key.
You are about to add the current key as a Teen Driver Key.
The current key has been successfully removed as a Teen Driver key. When used, no Teen Driver restrictions will be applied.
The current key has been successfully added as a Teen Driver key. When used, Teen Driver restrictions will be applied.
Teen Driver – Clear All Keys and PIN
Place the remote transmitter you want to add or remove in the registration pocket.
Teen Driver active. Audio is muted until all seat belts are fastened.
You are about to clear all Report Card values.
Select Clear All Teen Keys and PIN from the menu to retry.
Clear All Teen Keys and PIN Success
All keys and the PIN were cleared successfully.
Clear All Teen Keys and PIN Failed
You have selected to clear all your Teen Driver keys and PIN.

Check the following items and try again:
– Previously connected phone is in the vehicle
– Phone has Bluetooth enabled
– Phone has text message memory available
Startup Audio Volume controls the volume of infotainment system start-up sounds.
Maximum Startup Volume limits the volume of audio sources when you start your vehicle.
Set Date allows you to manually set the date. Use the controls to adjust the date.
Select Time Zone allows you to manually select the time zone. Use the controls to adjust the time.
AWD Optimisation specifies All-wheel drive calibrations for specific driving conditions or style to improve vehicle performance.\nSelect Auto to link AWD to the Drive Mode selector.
Adjusts steering effort to best match intended driving conditions or preference.

Display adjusts the appearance of the instrument cluster. Each specific drive condition or driving style has a complimentary cluster appearance.\nSelect Auto to link Display to the Drive Mode selector.
Remote Start Auto Cooled Seats automatically turns on cooled seats when using the Remote Start function on warm days.
Remote Start Auto Heated Seats automatically turns on heated seats when using the Remote Start function on cold days.

Left or Right Hand Traffic specifies the behaviour of the Adaptive Forward Lighting feature based on which side of the road the vehicle normally drives on.\nSelect Automatic (GPS) to automatically adjust this setting based on detected vehicle location.
Auto High Beam automatically turns main beam On or Off based on surrounding traffic.\nLow Sensitivity reduces the amount of the time that main beam is automatically adjusted.
Adaptive High Beam automatically adjusts main beam to direct light away from oncoming vehicles.\nLow Sensitivity reduces the amount of the time that main beam is automatically adjusted.
Adaptive Forward Lighting automatically adjusts the headlamps based on driving conditions.
Auto Mode Customisation controls Drive Modes based on your driving style. It can automatically switch the vehicle into or between Sport, Comfort, and Tour settings.

Reverse Tilt Mirror tilts one or both of the door mirrors down when the vehicle is shifted into Reverse. This improves the visibility of the ground near the rear wheels and is useful when parking next to a kerb.
Easy Exit Steering Column specifies if, and how, the steering column moves when you press the easy exit button or exit the vehicle.

Auto Memory Recall adjusts the driver seat, steering column, pedal and door mirror positions.
Select On - Driver Door Open to recall the positions when the driver door opens.
Select On - At Ignition to recall the positions when the ignition is turned on.
Auto Memory positions are dependent on which Remote Keyless Entry transmitter is used to unlock and start the vehicle.

This setting adjusts the appearance of the navigation map view and any downloaded apps optimised for day or night time conditions. Set to Auto for the display to automatically adjust based on bright/dark conditions.
Air Quality Sensor turns on Recirculation Mode based on detected outside air quality conditions.\nRecirculation Mode conditions and circulates cabin air rather than using outside air.
Alert Type refers to the type of alert you will receive from driver assistance systems to help you avoid crashes, either Beeps or Safety Alert Seat vibration pulses.

Front Pedestrian Detection alerts you when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly ahead and, if necessary, automatically applies the brakes or steers to help reduce the collision\'s severity or to avoid the collision.
Junction Stop Alert can alert you when you are about to drive through a red light or when you enter a junction and the vehicle detects a potential collision.

Rear Pedestrian Detection alerts you, while in reverse gear, when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly behind and, if necessary, automatically applies the brakes to help reduce the collision\'s severity or avoid the collision.
Auto Door Unlock specifies which, if any, doors will automatically unlock when the vehicle is shifted into park.
This setting specifies how quickly the Voice Recognition system speaks.
The Teen Driver Speed Warning option is currently off. Turn it on before setting the speed.
Valet Mode – Enter Code to Lock
Sending text message with unlock code.
Your vehicle settings were reset successfully.
Vehicle Locator Lights briefly turns on the exterior lights when you press the unlock button on the Remote Keyless Transmitter.
Daytime Tail Lights turns on the tail lights during daytime driving to improve the visibility of the vehicle to other drivers.
Open Door Anti Lock Out prevents the vehicle from being locked while a door is open.
Auto Door Lock automatically locks doors when the vehicle is shifted out of Park, or when the vehicle starts.
Delayed Door Lock will lock the vehicle a short time after all doors are closed.
Remote Unlock Light Feedback provides confirmation that the vehicle is unlocked. Select Flash Lights to flash the exterior lights when you remotely unlock the vehicle.
Remote Door Unlock adjusts which door is unlocked when pressing the unlock button once on the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter.
Relock Remotely Unlocked Doors secures the vehicle if doors are not opened within 30 seconds of using the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter to unlock doors.
Remote Start allows you to start the vehicle from a remote distance by pressing the Remote Start button on the Keyless Entry transmitter.

Remote Window Operation specifies if the vehicle\'s windows can be remotely opened or closed by double pressing and holding the unlock button or the lock button respectively on the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter.
This setting specifies which doors unlock when you use the button on the driver\'s door handle to unlock the vehicle.
Remote Left in Vehicle Alert alerts you when the remote Keyless Entry transmitter is left in the vehicle and the vehicle is not running.
This setting specifies how the Sliding Door Courtesy or Security
Automatic Time and Date uses GPS, RDS, and mobile network signals to keep the system time and date current. Select Off to manually set time and date.
Automatic Time Zone updates the system time zone based on vehicle location. Select Off to manually select the time zone.
24-hour Format changes the time display to a 24-hour clock format. For example, 07:00 pm displays as 19:00 when On.
Proximity Sensing controls the display of buttons in the map view. When On, buttons appear only when you move your hand toward the touchscreen. Select Off to keep the buttons visible at all times.
Startup Sounds specifies if sounds are played when your infotainment system starts up.
Audible Touch Feedback specifies if sounds play when you press the touchscreen or a physical control on the radio faceplate.
This setting determines whether voice sessions provide tutorial feedback on the centre display.
Rear Seat Reminder displays an alert in the instrument cluster when an infant or large object may have been left in the vehicle.
Sport Steering stiffens the steering feel while in Sport Mode.
Sport Display adjusts the appearance of the instrument cluster to a sport-themed display while in Sport Mode.
Sport Suspension stiffens the suspension feel while in Sport Mode.
Sport AWD optimises All-wheel drive calibrations to improve vehicle performance while in Sport Mode.
Sport Driver\'s Seat adjusts the driver\'s seat bolsters for increased lateral support while in Sport Mode.
Sport Passenger Seat adjusts the passenger seat bolsters for increased lateral support while in Sport Mode.
Sport Adaptive Cruise Control enables enhanced dynamic behaviour of adaptive cruise control mode while in Sport Mode.
Auto Cooled Seats automatically turns on seat cooling at vehicle start-up when the cabin temperature is significantly warmer than desired.
Auto Heated Seats automatically turns on seat heating at vehicle start-up when the cabin temperature is significantly cooler than desired.

Rear Climate On Startup controls the behaviour of the rear climate system at vehicle startup.\nMimic Front syncs the rear settings with the front driver climate settings.\nLast Know retains the rear climate settings from the previous trip.
Auto Demist automatically directs air to the windscreen to assist in demisting, based on temperature and humidity conditions.
Auto Rear Demist turns on the rear window demister based on temperature and humidity conditions.
Rapid Heat - Elevated Idle increases the engine idle speed to heat the cabin of the vehicle more quickly.

Engine Assisted Heating uses the petrol engine to assist in heating the cabin of the vehicle. The engine starts to save battery power when On.\nUse Deferred to turn on the engine only in extremely cold conditions.

Auto Air Distribution controls the way air flows in the vehicle when using Auto Climate Control. Direct Airflow results in more air being directed toward the occupants. Diffuse Airflow results in less.
Engine Assisted Heating Plugged In uses the petrol engine to assist in heating the cabin of the vehicle while it is charging. The engine starts to save battery power when On.
Pedestrian Friendly Alert plays a sound outside of your vehicle when travelling at low speeds to help pedestrians hear you.
Connected Vehicle Braking Alert notifies you if Vehicle-to-Vehicle (V2V) connected vehicles in front of you suddenly brake, giving you more time to react.
Connected Vehicle Traffic and Roadside Information specifies if connected vehicles or devices ahead of you share traffic conditions or events that could affect your travel.
Drowsy Driver Alert notifies you when your driving behaviour suggests that you are too tired to drive.
Side Blind Zone Alert provides door mirror alerts to help you avoid colliding with a moving vehicle detected in your side blind spot (or zone) during a lane change manoeuvre.

Lane Change Alert provides door mirror alerts to help you avoid colliding with a moving vehicle detected in their side blind spot (or zone) or a vehicle that is rapidly approaching your side blind spot during a lane change manoeuvre.
Seat Belt Tightening automatically adjusts your seat belts to a snug fit when buckled. The seat belts tighten when you first buckle up and during rough driving or road conditions.
Park Assist can alert you to objects near your vehicle during low speed manoeuvres.
Parking Assist Towbar specifies if Park Assist will work properly when a small item, such as a hitch ball, is attached to the vehicle hitch.
Rear Camera Parking Assist Symbols are warning icons displayed on the camera view when the Parking Assist System detects an object.
Rear Cross Traffic Alert can alert you to traffic approaching from the rear left or rear right of your vehicle during low speed reversing manoeuvres.
Easy Exit Driver\'s Seat adjusts the driver\'s seat when you press the easy exit button or turn off and exit the vehicle.
Easy Exit Options specifies whether pressing the Easy Exit button will move the driver\'s seat rearward when exiting the vehicle.
Auto Mirror Folding allows the door mirrors to be folded in by pressing the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter lock button for about 1 second. Pressing Unlock on the remote unfolds the mirrors.
Personalisation by Driver updates your personal vehicle settings based on the key being used.
Auto Wipe in Reverse Gear automatically turns on the rear window wiper when the vehicle is in Reverse and moisture is detected.

Rain Sense Wipers automatically turns on the windscreen wipers when moisture is detected and the wiper switch is in the intermittent mode. Rain sensitivity can be adjusted by rotating the intermittent wiper control.

Remote Lock Feedback provides confirmation that the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter locked the vehicle. Select Lights and Horn to flash the exterior lights and honk the horn when you lock the vehicle using the remote.
Exit Lighting specifies how long the exterior lamps stay on when you exit the vehicle and it is dark outside.
Adjusts damper level for specific driving conditions or preference.
Forward Collision System can alert you to a potential crash with a detected vehicle ahead and, if you haven\'t already, it can apply the brakes to help reduce a collision\'s severity.
Clear All Teen Keys and PIN
Chime Volume sets the volume level for in-vehicle chimes such as door ajar or headlamps left on.
Use the time provided by the network.
Use the time zone provided by the network.

Extended Hill Start Assist prevents your vehicle from rolling backwards on a steep hill if the brake pedal is not depressed. Standard hold keeps the vehicle stationary for about 3 seconds. Extended hold works for up to 5 minutes, and may also automatically apply the parking brake.
Long and Auto Parking Brake On
Adaptive High Beam automatically adjusts main beam to direct light away from oncoming vehicles.
Audio Volume Limit specifies if audio sound is limited for Teen Drivers. Adjust the maximum volume under the Set Audio Volume Limit setting.
Your app data settings, user profiles and personal data have been successfully deleted from the system.

Pollution Control automatically turns on Recirculation Mode at low vehicle speeds. This helps to reduce poor air quality inside the vehicle in certain driving conditions such as congestion. Recirculation Mode conditions and circulates cabin air rather than using outside air.

Auto Fan Speed controls the amount of airflow in the cabin (Low, Medium, or High) when climate control is set to Auto. Higher fan speeds result in faster temperature adjustments but may result in more in-cabin noise.
Force stopping an app may cause it to misbehave.
This will reset preferred applications that have been set to open when selecting a function. No application data will be lost. Press Clear to continue.
This setting adjusts the seating position, seat position when leaving the vehicle, wing mirror and pedal positions based on your saved preferences.
Left or Right Hand Traffic specifies the behaviour of the Adaptive Forward Lighting feature based on which side of the road the vehicle drives on.
Auto High Beam specifies whether the vehicle\'s high beams automatically turn On or Off based on surrounding traffic.
This setting automatically reshapes the beams of light produced by the headlights, pointing your high beam away from oncoming vehicles.

Location Services allows apps and services to identify your vehicle location for improved performance. You can turn location services Off to keep this information private. Emergency services are not affected in Off mode.
Data Services allows apps to use your data plan for downloads and streaming. You can turn data sharing Off to prevent data use. Emergency services are not affected in Off mode.
Ionizer helps neutralise smells and particles inside the vehicle cabin.
You are about to erase all data from your system. This removes all user accounts and resets all settings.
Your system preference settings were successfully reset.

This setting allows you to select how many Favourites pages can be viewed from the Audio application. The auto setting will automatically adjust this number based on the number of favourites you have saved.

Auto Air Distribution controls the way air flows in the vehicle when using Auto Climate Control. Direct Airflow results in more air being directed toward the occupants. Diffuse Airflow results in less. Oscillating varies between direct and diffuse airflow
Surround View Lighting turns on vehicle side lights to improve image quality when using the Surround View camera system.
Remote Removed From Vehicle Alert warns you by beeping the horn 3 times if you exit the a running vehicle with the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter.
Connect Android Auto Phone to USB
Once this feature is enabled, a phone may launch Apple CarPlay when connected to USB.
Preferred for better connection.\nMay also enable future wireless connections.
Connect Apple CarPlay Phone to USB
Could not connect to the selected phone.\nPlease check phone\'s connection settings.
Are you sure you want to disconnect this phone?\nActive calls on this phone may be moved to the handset.
Are you sure? Network will be removed from Wi-Fi networks list and no longer auto connect.
The device below will be removed from the Phones list in order to pair your new phone.
Could not connect to selected Wi-Fi network.
Older devices cannot connect to the wireless network while Wireless Screen Sharing is enabled.
Connect device via USB to use Screen Sharing.

1. Turn phone on.
2. Open Settings, select Bluetooth.
3. Set Bluetooth to on.
4. Select vehicle name %1$s.

1. Switch phone on.
2. Open Settings and select Wi-Fi.
3. Set Wi-Fi to on.
4. Select – %1$s.
5. Enter the code shown on the vehicle screen.
Select the vehicle name shown below from your phone\'s Bluetooth Settings list.
Is this the code shown on your phone?
Plug in supported phone to launch Apple CarPlay.
Once this feature is enabled, a phone may launch Android Auto when connected to USB.
USB connection for Apple CarPlay or Android Auto. Most phones and devices can connect to the Wi-Fi hotspot to share its data.
Wireless and USB connection for Apple CarPlay or Android Auto. Disables the Wi-Fi hotspot for older phones and devices.
devices can use the Wi-Fi Hotspot.
the Wi-Fi Hotspot is off. Devices cannot connect.
devices can use the Wi-Fi hotspot and its data.
devices can use the Wi-Fi hotspot but not its data.
Not sharing data with connected devices
Older devices cannot connect when Wireless Screen Sharing is enabled. Please open Advanced Wi-Fi Services to change this setting.
Change vehicle Wi-Fi name (must be 1-24 characters)
Change Vehicle Wi-Fi Password (must be 8-24 characters)
devices can use the Wi-Fi hotspot and connect wirelessly to screen sharing applications.
use data services while signal roaming.
do not use data services while signal is roaming
Use this network for vehicle software updates

plurals.name: cm_outgoing_incoming_calls_min_remaining
plurals.item: Outgoing and incoming calls - %1$d minutes remaining
Outgoing and incoming calls - %1$d minute remaining
Outgoing and incoming calls - %1$d minutes remaining
Outgoing and incoming calls - %1$d minutes remaining
Outgoing and incoming calls - %1$d minutes remaining
Outgoing and incoming calls - %1$d minutes remaining

resources.string: Connecting over USB is suggested as it may enable your device to connect wirelessly in the future.
Select the name shown below in your device\'s Wi-Fi Direct settings.
Use this network for vehicle software updates.
To activate, visit the %1$s or push the blue %1$s button to reach an Advisor.
Plug in a phone with the Android Auto app installed.
Plug in supported device to launch Android Auto.
This device may not be supported.
This service requires Hands-Free calling minutes to be available. Press the %3$s button or push the blue %1$s button to speak with an %2$s Advisor.
The Favourite Phone connects before other phones.
Once this feature is enabled, a device may launch MirrorLink when connected to USB.
Tap Connect to accept connection from the phone shown below.
Connect Android Auto via Wi-Fi Direct
1. Switch phone on. 2. Open Settings and select Wi-Fi. 3. Select Wi-Fi Direct. 4. Select – %1$s. 5. Confirm the connection from the phone on the vehicle screen.
Plug in a supported device to launch MirrorLink.
Certain apps will be displayed on this screen when supported by the device. Connecting via USB is suggested as it may enable your device to connect wirelessly in the future.
Enabling Wi-Fi connection will allow your device to connect wirelessly next time.
Enable connection to %1$s via Wi-Fi when available.
Make calls, access recent calls and view contact list
Only one Favorite Phone can be set.
Only WPA/WPA2-secured Wi-Fi metworks can be added.
A current phone may be disconnected, moving any active calls to the handset.
%1$s on %2$s will end, and active calls may be transferred to the handset.
Allow Bluetooth connection alongside another phone
Would you like to save changes?
This network is not secure enough. Please choose a WPA/WPA2-secured Wi-Fi network.
Are you sure you want to disconnect this device from the Wi-Fi Hotspot?
Are you sure? This phone will be removed from the Phones list and no longer automatically connect.
Cannot change users while a phone call is active.
Clearing your PIN will allow anyone in the vehicle to sign in to your profile and access your data and settings.
This will be the name of the vehicle shown on the web portal and mobile application.
Always require PIN when signing in
Secure your profile with a PIN
This will be the username displayed in the vehicle.
The identifier(s) you choose will allow this vehicle to recognise you.
You have not finished setting up your new profile. The unfinished profile will be deleted if you exit.
Would you like to secure your profile with a PIN? The PIN may be required at vehicle startup depending on your settings.
If you are not %1$s, select your profile now.
%1$s is already signed in for this vehicle. Please use a different email address.
Your profile is complete. Check your email and approve your new account.
Your profile is complete and has been added to your vehicle.
Would you like to synchronise your profile online to back up your preferences and use them in other vehicles?
Your vehicle settings can be backed up and moved between vehicles.
You can customise this vehicle for different drivers.
Your key can be used to automatically identify you.
%1$s is already being used by %2$s. If you continue, it will no longer be used to identify %2$s.
%1$s does not have an associated account. Would you like to try a different email address or create a new account?
Sorry, this feature is only available once you have purchased the vehicle.
The vehicle must be turned on to access the Users application.
Unverified user account. Please verify your activation status and connect to a network.
Unverified user account. Verify email to maintain connected services.
This profile will be removed from the vehicle. Saved profile information can still be accessed using the vehicle account. Any data not synced to the vehicle account will be lost.
All settings associated with this profile will be lost.
Select a user to sign in.
If you do not connect your profile, your settings will not be backed up online and cannot be moved to other vehicles.
Check your device\'s network settings or your remaining %1$s data. Alternatively, you can try connecting to a different Wi-Fi network.
Vehicle Key %1$s was removed as an identifier from your profile by %2$s.
Go to the Profile Identifiers screen to make changes.
This will become your username for your GM account. If you have an account already, we\'ll let you sign in on the next page.
Please wait 10 minutes before trying again.
If you sign out, your settings will no longer be backed up online and you will be unable to move them to other vehicles. You can sign back in later.
Please enter the password for your vehicle account.
This will be the password you use to access your account.
This is your username for your GM account.
Unverified user account. Please verify email to maintain connected services.
Unverified user account. Please verify to maintain connected services.
Your profile is complete. Please check your phone and approve your new account.
The email address or phone number used to create your account may not be valid. Please contact an %1$s Advisor to update your email or phone number.
%1$s is already signed in on this vehicle. Please use a different phone number or email address.
The email address or phone number used to create your account may not be valid. Please sign in to your account on the website to update your email address or phone number.
Select a user to sign in.
Unverified user account. Please verify to maintain connected services.
%1$s was removed as an identifier from your profile by %2$s. Visit the Profile Identifiers screen to make changes.
The vehicle will need to remain parked and turned off during the update.
Download when connected to the following networks:
Checking for updates.\nLast checked for updates on %1$s at %2$s.
No updates available.\nLast checked for updates on %1$s at %2$s.
Check your device\'s network settings or your remaining %1$s data. Alternatively, you can try connecting to a different Wi-Fi network.
If you decline this update, you will no longer be able to install it. You will need to contact your dealer for assistance if you would like to install this update later.
You must accept the Terms and Conditions, or this update will not be installed. To accept, press \'Agree\'. To decline, press Cancel - you will not receive a software update.
The software update has failed. Contact your dealer for assistance with installing this update.
The vehicle must be in Park to apply system updates.
Updates cannot be applied when the battery is low. Charge the battery by running the vehicle, or connect to a charger.
The system must restart to complete the update process. Please turn off the vehicle, open and close the driver\'s door and wait at least two minutes before starting the vehicle again.
System will turn off automatically in a few moments.
Do not take the vehicle out of Park, remove the USB drive or turn the engine off as this will interrupt the update.
The vehicle was taken out of Park. The current update file is completing. Do not remove the USB drive until the update is complete.
Vehicle update is ready to download.
Vehicle update is ready to resume.
The vehicle cannot be taken out of Park until the update is complete. Do not remove the USB drive or turn the engine off as this will interrupt the update.
The following update file is invalid: %1$s
The following update file is not valid for use in this vehicle: %1$s
Your system is not registered and may experience errors when using %1$s and connected services.\n\nContact your dealer to correct this issue.
The software update was unsuccessful.\nYou can retry the update next time you place your vehicle in Park. If the error persists, contact your dealer.
Insert a device containing the system update file %1$s to begin the update process.
Update divided into parts for download. Each part starts automatically when available. This could take up to several hours.
System will turn off automatically in a few moments.
Download new updates in the background
Last checked for updates at %2$s on %1$s.
Last checked for updates at %2$s on %1$s.
You do not need to remain in the vehicle. If you do leave, don\'t forget your keys.
You do not need to remain in the vehicle. If you do leave, don\'t forget your keys.
Please place gear lever in Park mode.
The vehicle will need to remain parked with the engine running during the update.

This setting prevents your vehicle from rolling backwards on a steep hill. Standard hold keeps the vehicle stationary for about 3 seconds. Extended hold works for up to 5 minutes, and may also automatically apply the handbrake
A current phone may be disconnected, moving any active calls to the handset.
Vehicle Wi-Fi Name must be 1 – 14 characters
Vehicle Wi-Fi password must be 8 – 24 characters
Your system is successfully registered and can use %1$s and connected services.
Vehicle conditions are not ideal at this time to proceed with this update. Retry the update next time you place your vehicle into Park. If conditions persist, contact your dealer.
This setting controls the vehicle response when you are entering an intersection where the vehicle detects a possible crash. It can prevent or reduce the severity of a crash by providing alerts.
Teen Driver Speed Limiter restricts the vehicle to a maximum speed of %1$d mph/%2$d km/h for Teen Drivers.
Auto Volume adjusts your radio volume based on vehicle speed. Select the relative volume level you prefer.
Passive Door Lock specifies if the vehicle will automatically lock, or lock and alert you after all the doors are closed, and you walk away from the vehicle with the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter.
Teen Mode - Enter Code to Unlock

Android Auto allows you to interact directly with your phone on the radio screen. This feature must be enabled both here and on the connected phone. You can access the feature by pressing the Android Auto icon on the home screen, or by a long press of the Voice button on the steering wheel.

Voice Recognition Sharing sends your voice sessions to a cloud-based voice recognition system. You can turn this off to prevent the system from sharing and recording your voice. This may limit the system\'s ability to understand you and may disable some features.
Cannot change users while in a phone call.
This setting adjusts the appearance of any downloaded apps optimised for day or night time conditions. Set to Auto for the display to automatically adjust based on bright/dark conditions.
Connect a new phone?\n\n%1$s may be disconnected, moving any active calls to the handset.
Set Teen Driver Speed Warning specifies a speed limit for displaying a speed warning for Teen Drivers. The speed can be specified between %1$s and %2$s.
Your changes have not been specified. Press the Apply Changes button to confirm changes.
First, place your key in the registration pocket and then press OK. See the owner\'s manual for pocket location.
No remote key was detected. First, place the key in the registration pocket and then select Retry.
The Demo Mode feature is unavailable while driving.
Extended Mode is unavailable when the vehicle is in gear. Set the vehicle in Neutral or Park.
System unable to change to the selected setting values.
Feature unavailable due to loss of communication between modules.
The user settings have been successfully restored.
Please insert USB device containing the settings restore file %1$s to start process.
The settings cannot be restored when the battery is low. Charge the battery by running the vehicle or connect to a charger. You may then retry restoring the settings.
Insert USB device to save user settings.
Multiple USB devices present. Please remove all but one USB device in order to save user settings.
There was an error writing to the USB device. Please insert USB device with sufficient free space and check that it is not write protected.
There was an error saving the user settings. Please retry. If errors continue, please visit your dealer.
The user settings have been saved successfully.
This setting indicates when you are driving in a manner that conserves fuel.

This application allows you to select a colour for the ambient lighting in your vehicle. Select from the grid to change the lighting to your desired colour. This feature can be turned off by using the on/off toggle button. The Link to Drive Mode option will change the Ambient Lighting to match the colour being used in the instrument cluster based on the setting of the Drive Mode button. Demo mode will cycle the ambient lighting through all the available colours. This is only available when the vehicle is parked.
Do not remove USB drive until restore has been completed. You may power down the vehicle and resume later at any time.

Tap Step Speed defines the increments for adjusting the engine speed.\nUse the Set + and Res - steering wheel buttons to adjust the speed up or down by the selected increments.\nPower Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch.

Standby Speed specifies the initial speed to engage the Power Take-Off feature. This speed is not required to continue using the feature once it has been engaged. Power Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch.

Set 1 Speed specifies the lower set of speeds the engine can run at while using Power Take-Off.\nPower Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch.

Set 2 Speed specifies the upper set of speeds the engine can run at while using Power Take-Off.\nPower Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch.

Shut Down Time sets the amount of time the vehicle engine will continue to run while using Power Take-Off.\nPower Take-Off allows the vehicle to power an attached piece of equipment, such as an air compressor or winch, using its engine.

Automatic Running Boards adjusts the position of the running boards on the vehicle.\nSelect On to automatically retract the running boards when the vehicle doors close or the vehicle is moving.\nSelect Extended to keep the running board out; the vehicle must be in Park or Neutral to select and use this mode.

Handsfree Tailgate/Boot Lid Control specifies the behaviour of the automated Tailgate/Boot Lid.\nSelect On - Open and Close to enable handsfree open and closing capability.\nSelect On-Open Only to prevent the tailgate from being closed using the handsfree operation.
Gesture Indication lets you use various hand gestures over the touchpad to interact with the display screen.
Touchpad Surface turns the touchpad controller On or Off.
Tap to Enter allows you to tap the touchpad to make a selection. This lets you skip pushing a button or touching the screen.
Haptic Feedback lets you feel vibration in the touchpad when you interact with buttons or links on the display screen.
Location Based Charging configures the charge settings from your electric vehicle based on its geographic location.
Energy Summary Pop-up displays a summary of your battery and fuel usage since your last full charge before you exit the vehicle.
Charge Status Feedback provides an audible and/or visual indication outside the vehicle while charging.
Charge Cord Theft Alert warns you if your charge cord may have been stolen by flashing your vehicle\'s lights and honking its horn.
Charge Power Loss Alert warns you that your vehicle is no longer charging by flashing your vehicle\'s lights and honking its horn.
Location Based Auto Lift changes the vehicle ride height based on GPS location.\nUse the Navigation system to specify locations where ride height should changed.
This vehicle is recording audio and video
AWD Optimisation specifies All Wheel Drive calibrations for specific driving conditions or style to improve vehicle performance while in %1$s.
Engine Sound actively adjusts the sound of the engine to best match intended driving conditions or style while in %1$s.
Engine Sound actively adjusts the sound of the engine to best match intended driving conditions or style while in %1$s.
Steering adjusts how the steering feels to best match intended driving conditions or style while in %1$s.
Suspension adjusts damper and/or spring rates for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s.
Brake Response adjusts the brake pedal response for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s.
Ride Height specifies which vehicle ride height to use while in %1$s.
Cursor Tracking Speed controls how fast the cursor and highlight move around the screen. You can speed up or slow down the touchpad\'s response to your movements.
Ride Height specifies which vehicle ride height to use in this mode.\nChanging the ride height can impact ground clearance, fuel economy, and entry/exit of the vehicle.
Powertrain optimises the characteristics of the accelerator pedal, throttle response, engine and gear shifting for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s.
Competitive Driving Mode - Active Handling Off

Competition Mode adjusts key vehicle characteristics such as, active handling, and electronic stability control to improve vehicle performance on race tracks. Performance Traction Management (PTM) is intended for track use only and integrates the Traction Control, StabiliTrak, and Magnetic Ride Control systems to provide improved and consistent performance when cornering. The amount of available engine power is based on the mode selected, track conditions, driver skill, and the radius of each corner. Active Handling Controls (Traction Control and Electronic Stability Control) are reduced or turned off in performance Traction Modes (PTM) (1-5). This setting only applies while in Custom Drive Mode.

Junction Stop Alert can alert you when you are about to drive through a red light or when you enter a junction and the vehicle detects a potential collision. It can prevent or reduce the severity of a collision by helping you brake.
Video Voice Over specifies whether visually impaired users will receive audio feedback for video playback and when navigating the rear seat entertainment system.

Allow Prompt Interruptions controls whether you can speak voice commands before voice prompts finish. You can turn this On if you usually know the command you want to speak and don\'t need to hear the full prompt. This feature may result in accidental interruptions caused by background noise or talking
Rear Seat Audio Controls turns the 2nd row audio controls On or Off.
SiriusXM Explicit Content Filter prevents Teen drivers from accessing explicit content channels.
Remote Mirror Folding allows the outside mirrors to be folded in by pressing the Remote Keyless Entry transmitter lock button for about 1 second. Pressing unlock on the remote unfolds the mirrors.

This setting recalls positions for the driver seat and steering column, outside mirrors, and pedals (if equipped) of memory button 1 or 2 when the ignition is turned on. If the previously stored positions are not recalled, try using the other remote.

This setting recalls positions for the driver seat and steering column, outside mirrors, and pedals (if equipped) of the exit memory button when the ignition is turned off and the driver\'s door is opened.

This application allows you to select a colour for the ambient lighting in your vehicle. Select from the grid to change the lighting to your desired colour.
This feature can be turned off by using the on/off toggle button.
The Link to Drive Mode option will change the Ambient Lighting to match the colour being used in the instrument cluster based on the setting of the Drive Mode button. Demo Mode will cycle the ambient lighting through all the available colours. This is only available when the vehicle is parked.
Brightness can be adjusted from low to medium to high by using the icons at the bottom of the screen.
Brake Response adjusts the brake pedal response for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s.

Active Aero specifies which active aerodynamics setting is used while in %1$s.\nEach setting adjusts the rear wing/spoiler and other aerodynamic elements to optimise vehicle performance for specific conditions or driving style.

Active Aero specifies which active aerodynamics setting is used while in %1$s.\nEach setting adjusts the rear wing/spoiler and other aerodynamic elements to optimise vehicle performance for specific conditions or driving style.

Left / Right Invert specifies on-screen behaviour in response to the horizontal movement of your fingers on the Touchpad.\nSelect Default to have the screen behaviour match finger movement on the Touchpad.\nSelect Inverted to have screen behaviour behave in the opposite way.

Up / Down Invert specifies on-screen behaviour in response to the vertical movement of your fingers on the Touchpad.\nSelect Default to have the screen behaviour match finger movement on the Touchpad.\nSelect Inverted to have screen behaviour behave in the opposite way.
Suspension adjusts damper and/or spring rates for specific driving conditions or style while in %1$s.
%1$s may be disconnected, moving any active calls to the handset.

This setting description is not available while driving.

Allow Prompt Interruptions controls if you can speak voice commands before voice prompts finish. You can turn this On if you usually know the command you want to speak and don\'t need to hear the full prompt. This feature may result in accidental interruptions caused by background noise or talking.
This setting turns the 2nd row audio controls On or Off.
This setting controls the vehicle response when detecting a vehicle ahead of you. It can prevent or reduce the severity of a collision by providing alerts or helping you brake.
Advanced Range Estimation uses historical energy usage based on time of day, season and climate control settings to prove a more accurate estimated battery range.

Reverse Tilt Mirror tilts the wing mirrors down when the vehicle is placed into Reverse. This improves the visibility of the ground near the rear wheels and is useful when parking next to a curb.

Side View Camera specifies if using the indicator during a lane change will also display an applicable side view of your trailer and vehicle. This allows you to see the area to the side of the vehicle and trailer that may otherwise be obscured.
Trailer Length Overlay specifies if guidelines corresponding to the length of the trailer are shown when the side trailer camera is active. Set Trailer Length through the Trailer application.
Jack-Knife Alerts specifies if alerts occur while you are backing up and your trailer is about to jack-knife.
Cargo Bed Camera Lighting specifies if the truck bed rail lights are turned on when the cargo bed camera is active.
Rear Pedestrian Detection alerts you, while in reverse gear, when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly behind to help reduce the collision\'s severity or avoid the collision.
Hold device against the NFC sensor for longer
Hold device against the NFC sensor for longer
Parking Assist Towbar specifies if Park Assist will work properly when a small item, such as a hitch ball, is attached to the vehicle hitch.
Rear Pedestrian Detection alerts you while in reverse gear when a collision is imminent with a pedestrian detected directly behind %1$s to help reduce the collision’s severity or avoid the collision.
Automatic Entry/Egress Assist specifies if the vehicle will automatically lower to make it easier to enter or exit the vehicle.
Forward Collision System can alert you to a potential crash with a detected vehicle ahead and, if you haven\'t already, it can apply the brakes and steer to help reduce a collision\'s severity.

Handsfree Tailgate/Boot Lid Control specifies the behaviour of the automated Tailgate/Boot Lid.\nSelect On - Open and Close to enable handsfree open and closing capability.\nSelect On-Open Only to prevent the tailgate from being closed using the handsfree operation.
